A donut is made by deep-frying a dough made of flour, sugar, eggs, and milk. The dough is then shaped into a ring and glazed or topped with a variety of toppings.

This donut is made by deep-frying a doughnut-shaped piece of dough, usually in vegetable oil. After frying, the donut is often glazed, frosted, or decorated with sprinkles, chocolate chips, or other toppings.
